title: Direct to Indirect: Statements
description: Practice converting 20 assertive sentences, focusing on tense and pronoun changes.

cards.front:
1. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "I work in a factory."
cards.back:
He said that **he worked** in a factory.
*(Simple Present → Simple Past)*

cards.front:
2. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "I am reading a book."
cards.back:
She said that **she was reading** a book.
*(Present Continuous → Past Continuous)*

cards.front:
3. Change to Indirect:
> They said, "We have finished the job."
cards.back:
They said that **they had finished** the job.
*(Present Perfect → Past Perfect)*

cards.front:
4. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "I have been waiting for hours."
cards.back:
He said that **he had been waiting** for hours.
*(Present Perfect Cont. → Past Perfect Cont.)*

cards.front:
5. Change to Indirect:
> John said, "I bought a new laptop."
cards.back:
John said that **he had bought** a new laptop.
*(Simple Past → Past Perfect)*

cards.front:
6. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "I was walking down the street."
cards.back:
She said that **she had been walking** down the street.
*(Past Continuous → Past Perfect Continuous)*

cards.front:
7. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "I had already eaten."
cards.back:
He said that **he had already eaten**.
*(Past Perfect remains unchanged)*

cards.front:
8. Change to Indirect:
> The boy said, "I will call you later."
cards.back:
The boy said that **he would call me** later.
*(Will → Would)*

cards.front:
9. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "I can swim well."
cards.back:
She said that **she could swim** well.
*(Can → Could)*

cards.front:
10. Change to Indirect:
> They said, "We may go to Paris."
cards.back:
They said that **they might go** to Paris.
*(May → Might)*

cards.front:
11. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "I must finish this report."
cards.back:
He said that **he had to finish that** report.
*(Must → Had to)*

cards.front:
12. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "I should visit the dentist."
cards.back:
She said that **she should visit** the dentist.
*(Should remains unchanged)*

cards.front:
13. Change to Indirect:
> Tom said, "I am meeting my brother **tomorrow**."
cards.back: Tom said that he was meeting his brother **the next day** (or the following day).

cards.front:
14. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "I saw him **yesterday**."
cards.back: She said that she had seen him **the day before** (or the previous day).

cards.front:
15. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "I am busy **now**."
cards.back: He said that he was busy **then**.

cards.front:
16. Change to Indirect:
> They said, "We moved **here** two years **ago**."
cards.back: They said that they had moved **there** two years **before**.

cards.front:
17. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "**This** is my favorite book."
cards.back: She said that **that** was her favorite book.

cards.front:
18. Exception Rule:
> He **says**, "I am happy."
cards.back:
He **says** that **he is** happy.
*(Reporting verb is present tense → No tense change)*

cards.front:
19. Exception Rule:
> The teacher said, "The sun rises in the east."
cards.back:
The teacher said that the sun **rises** in the east.
*(Universal Truth → No tense change)*

cards.front:
20. Change to Indirect:
> Mary said, "If I had money, I would travel."
cards.back:
Mary said that if **she had** money, she **would travel**.
*(Unreal past conditionals often remain unchanged)*

title: Direct to Indirect: Questions
description: Practice 20 interrogative sentences (Yes/No and WH- questions).

cards.front:
1. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "Do you like pizza?"
cards.back:
He asked **if** (or whether) I **liked** pizza.
*(Remove 'do', change to past)*

cards.front:
2. Change to Indirect:
> She asked him, "Did you see the movie?"
cards.back:
She asked him **if he had seen** the movie.
*(Did → Past Perfect)*

cards.front:
3. Change to Indirect:
> They asked, "Are you coming with us?"
cards.back: They asked **if I was coming** with them.

cards.front:
4. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "Have you finished?"
cards.back: He asked **if I had finished**.

cards.front:
5. Change to Indirect:
> She asked, "Will you help me?"
cards.back: She asked **if I would help** her.

cards.front:
6. Change to Indirect:
> Tom asked, "Can you speak French?"
cards.back: Tom asked **if I could speak** French.

cards.front:
7. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "Is this your pen?"
cards.back: He asked **if that was** my pen.

cards.front:
8. Change to Indirect:
> The stranger asked, "**Where** is the post office?"
cards.back:
The stranger asked **where the post office was**.
*(WH-word acts as connector; Verb goes to the end)*

cards.front:
9. Change to Indirect:
> She asked, "**What** are you doing?"
cards.back: She asked **what I was doing**.

cards.front:
10. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "**Who** broke the vase?"
cards.back: He asked **who had broken** the vase.

cards.front:
11. Change to Indirect:
> They asked, "**When** will the train arrive?"
cards.back: They asked **when the train would** arrive.

cards.front:
12. Change to Indirect:
> My mom asked, "**Why** did you come home late?"
cards.back: My mom asked **why I had come** home late.

cards.front:
13. Change to Indirect:
> The teacher asked, "**How** do you solve this?"
cards.back: The teacher asked **how I solved** that.

cards.front:
14. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "**Which** dress do you prefer?"
cards.back: He asked **which dress I preferred**.

cards.front:
15. Change to Indirect:
> She asked, "**Whose** car is this?"
cards.back: She asked **whose car that was**.

cards.front:
16. Change to Indirect:
> He asked me, "Do you know where she lives?"
cards.back: He asked me **if I knew** where she **lived**.

cards.front:
17. Change to Indirect:
> She asked, "Must I leave now?"
cards.back: She asked **if she had to** leave **then**.

cards.front:
18. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "May I come in?"
cards.back: He asked **if he might** come in.

cards.front:
19. Change to Indirect:
> They asked, "Don't you like ice cream?" (Negative Question)
cards.back: They asked **if I didn't like** ice cream.

cards.front:
20. Change to Indirect:
> He asked, "Where have you been?"
cards.back: He asked **where I had been**.

title: Direct to Indirect: Commands & Exclamations
description: Practice 20 examples including orders, requests, advice, and exclamations.

cards.front:
1. Change to Indirect:
> The teacher said, "**Sit down**."
cards.back:
The teacher **ordered** (or told) us **to sit down**.
*(Use infinitive 'to')*

cards.front:
2. Change to Indirect:
> She said to him, "**Please help** me."
cards.back:
She **requested** him **to help** her.
*(Please → requested)*

cards.front:
3. Change to Indirect:
> The doctor said, "**Don't smoke**."
cards.back: The doctor **advised** him **not to smoke**.

cards.front:
4. Change to Indirect:
> He said to the child, "**Don't touch** the fire!"
cards.back: He **warned** (or forbade) the child **not to touch** the fire.

cards.front:
5. Change to Indirect:
> The general said to the soldiers, "**March forward**!"
cards.back: The general **commanded** the soldiers **to march forward**.

cards.front:
6. Change to Indirect:
> My mother said, "**Work hard** for your exam."
cards.back: My mother **advised** (or urged) me **to work hard** for my exam.

cards.front:
7. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "**Let's go** for a walk."
cards.back:
He **suggested** (or proposed) that **they should go** for a walk.
*(OR: He suggested going for a walk)*

cards.front:
8. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "**Let me** explain."
cards.back: She **asked** (or requested) **to be allowed** to explain.

cards.front:
9. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "**Alas!** I have lost my phone."
cards.back: He **exclaimed with sorrow** that **he had lost** his phone.

cards.front:
10. Change to Indirect:
> The players said, "**Hurrah!** We won the match."
cards.back: The players **exclaimed with joy** that **they had won** the match.

cards.front:
11. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "**Wow!** What a beautiful painting."
cards.back: She **exclaimed with wonder** that the painting **was very beautiful**.

cards.front:
12. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "**How** fast you run!"
cards.back: He **exclaimed** (or remarked) that **I ran very fast**.

cards.front:
13. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "**Ugh!** This tastes terrible."
cards.back: She **exclaimed with disgust** that **it tasted** terrible.

cards.front:
14. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "**Good morning**, sir."
cards.back: He **respectfully wished** him a good morning.

cards.front:
15. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "**Goodbye**, friends."
cards.back: She **bade goodbye** to her friends.

cards.front:
16. Change to Indirect:
> The beggar said, "Please, please give me some food."
cards.back: The beggar **begged** for some food.

cards.front:
17. Change to Indirect:
> The boss said, "**Send** the email immediately."
cards.back: The boss **ordered** him **to send** the email immediately.

cards.front:
18. Change to Indirect:
> She said to her son, "**Remember** to lock the door."
cards.back: She **reminded** her son **to lock** the door.

cards.front:
19. Change to Indirect:
> He said, "**What** a tragedy!"
cards.back: He **exclaimed** that **it was a great** tragedy.

cards.front:
20. Change to Indirect:
> She said, "**Bravo!** You played well."
cards.back: She **applauded** him, saying that **he had played well**.
